thread.title: Accident Lawsuit Funding Reports Awning Collapse, with 22 Students Hospitalized
thread.title_full: Accident Lawsuit Funding Reports Awning Collapse, with 22 Students Hospitalized - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Accident Lawsuit Funding Reports Awning Collapse, with 22 Students Hospitalized
text:
Accidentlawsuitfunding.com
Accident Pre-Settlement and Settlement Funding Company says that earlier this month, a concrete awning collapsed at a North Carolina high school after a truck hit it, leaving at least 22 students who were standing underneath it injured with various wounds.
CHARLOTTE, N.C. , Oct. 23, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Accidentlawsuitfunding.com, a leading national lawsuit funding firm, reports today that earlier this month, a concrete awning collapsed at a high school in North Carolina after a truck hit it. At least 22 students who were standing underneath it when it collapsed were injured with a various range of wounds, from minor to serious, and at least one student had a life-threatening injury. The awning collapse occurred at North Iredell High School in Olin, North Carolina on a day where a band competition happened to be taking place. According to the NY Post, around 2:30pm , the awning was struck by a large truck, "causing it to collapse on students who were gathered underneath to seek shelter from the rain." According to the article in the NY Post, most of the students who were injured were from South Iredell High School and were there to attend the band competition.
Awning and deck or patio collapse accidents such as this one occur, and ALF is dedicated to helping victims involved in such incidents, as well as any incidents that result in personal injury, as they can be dangerous and sometimes fatal.
Chris Janish , CEO of ALF, commented on the recent awning collapse, "Cases like this are rare personal injury claims, but when large decks or awnings collapse, there is a possibility for serious injuries to many possible victims. Sometimes these accidents are due to construction site or residential mishap. Regardless, we intend to assist victims of these accidents as the cases are typically delayed by the courts or insurance companies."
ALF, a law cash advance company, as well as their funding partners, are committed to assisting people who have suffered personal injury in any sort of construction accident, including bus accidents, car wrecks, limo accidents, truck wrecks, or any other motor vehicle accident, including mass transit cases. Additionally, plaintiffs who have won large verdict on appeal cases that are tied up through the appellate process can also access funds immediately by applying for a judgment or verdict on appeal settlement funding.
To contact ALF to discuss how the company can assist you with your personal injury case, or to fill out an application for lawsuit funding online, visit: http://accidentlawsuitfunding.com/how-you-can-reach-us
For more details and information on how the ALF funding process works or to speak to a highly trained representative, visit: http://accidentlawsuitfunding.com/how-the-process-works
ALF is also accepting funding applications on any and all types of accident cases, including car accidents, truck accidents, motorcycle accidents, as well as all motor vehicle accidents and personal injury cases, including medical malpractice or doctor/hospital negligence. To speak with a representative to discuss how ALF can help you, please call the company's toll-free hotline at: 877.636.6010.
If you don't have an attorney, ALF can assist accident victims who have had mass transit or other personal injury accidents in New York and New Jersey with getting the proper legal representation before it is too late to file a claim. Contact ALF and they will put you in touch with a lawyer who can provide you with a free case evaluation.
For a full list of cases that the company funds, please visit the company's website at: http://accidentlawsuitfunding.com
Disclaimer: Be advised that the company funding programs should not be confused with any of the following: lawsuit loan, lawsuit loans, settlement loan, settlement loans, or a pre-settlement loan, as sometimes referred to from prospective clients. The lawsuit cash advance is a non-recourse transaction in which the client only has to repay the funds if their lawsuit is successful.
Contact: Chris Janish , CEO
Ph. 877.636.6010
